page.title: 08TOURISM (2)
page.content: A spot survey conducted in the Square one July afternoon, while not being numerous enough to give reliable results, did show a majority of tourists from the North of England (a coach tour had just arrived) closely followed by the United States. Many coach tours do stop in Stow and there are usually several cars with Western European numberplates to be seen. Many tourists are drawn by the many antique shops (see p.2) but most come simply to appreciate the countryside and the charm of the town. Lower Swell also has two small hotels that offer perhaps a little more peace than the centre of Stow.
